caption:
Why seismic  is needed

Blockchains solved trust in execution, but not trust in timing.
Everything is visible too early.

This causes real problems:
â€¢Traders see transactions and front-run them
â€¢Bidders see other bids and manipulate auctions
â€¢Validators see votes early and bias governance
â€¢Games leak state and players cheat
â€¢AI and data apps expose inputs and break privacy

Today, apps must choose between:
â€¢Accepting this broken transparency, or
â€¢Moving logic off-chain and bringing trust back in

Seismic fixes this.

Seismic introduces conditional disclosure:
data is committed on-chain, but only revealed when preset conditions are met.
â€¢No early leaks
â€¢No trusted intermediaries
â€¢No manual coordination

What this enables:
â€¢Auctions: bids stay hidden until reveal
â€¢Trading: intents stay private until execution
â€¢Governance: votes remain sealed until voting ends
â€¢Gaming: moves stay secret until turns resolve
â€¢Data & AI: inputs remain encrypted but verifiable

The key idea: privacy isnâ€™t just public or private.
Itâ€™s time-based.

Seismic makes privacy rule-based and time-aware.

Blockchains remain verifiable.
Users stay protected.
Apps finally work like real-world systems.
